Description: Rim and neck sherd of South Ionian pottery krater; highly worn; cream slip at least on outside; inside, reserved except for black band at rim; on top of rim no visible decoration save one band, outside won, underside glazed; on neck, between bands, metopal frieze of maeanders and squares filled with X and blobs or just blobs.
Curator's comments: Nadine Pantaleon dates this to 610-590 BC (Die Kratere der archaische Zeit aus Naukratis, unpublished dissertation, Bochum, 2011, 283, Naukr.1).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.019)
